title: those poverty least able weather
story: Those in poverty will be least able to weather brutal storm of climate changePeople who are already living in poverty shouldnt have to pay more for green subsidies - let those with the broadest shoulders contribute more, argues Clare Lorraine Phipps of Taxpayers Against PovertyWhile the wealthiest can buy air con in the summer and turn up the heating in the winter, the three million in the UK already experiencing fuel poverty do not have that luxury Image: Getty Images iStockphotoopinionByClare Lorraine Phipps:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | comments Delegates arriving in Glasgow for COP this week complained of chaotic scenes - left queuing in the cold for hours, with no protection from the elements. Rewind eight months, and queues in Scotland’s second largest city also made the headlines: a viral photo showed  people waiting for a soup kitchen in snow and subzero temperatures. At Taxpayers Against Poverty we are campaigning for a future where the queues we witnessed in February are a thing of the past. But the climate crisis means that future is under threat. Those standing in line for food are likely to be the least responsible for carbon emissions, but they will be disproportionately affected. A study by Oxfam found the richest  percent of the world’s population produce twice as much carbon as the poorest  percent. It’s not hard to see why - in the UK  percent of flights are made by a wealthy  percent of the population. Over halfdon’t fly abroad at all. The report concluded that “the over-consumption of a wealthy minority is fuelling the climate crisis, yet it is poor communities paying the price”. Covid showed us that where we work is an important determinant of our exposure to risk, and the same is true for the effects of climate breakdown. Itaposs easier to avoid exposure to high temperatures or extreme weather when you work in an office. And that exposure continues in the home - those on lower incomes are more likely to live in crowded accommodation prone to overheating.Poorer communities are also concentrated in urban areas - such as in Haringey, where our founder Rev. Paul Nicolson lived - where temperatures run even higher due to the Urban Heat Island effect.While the wealthiest can buy air con in the summer and turn up the heating in the winter, the three million in the UK already experiencing fuel poverty do not have that luxury. Housing charity Shelter has found that over a quarter of renters already live in homes they cannot adequately heat. The effects of extreme weather are even more pronounced for those without a home. In the year before the pandemic, an estimated  people died while sleeping rough in London. That’s a figure that will only increasewe do not take action: climatologists predict extremely cold winters will be on the increase. What are we asking of our leaders as they meet this week  Firstly, we need to bring people who are experiencing poverty to the table. Our leaders are overwhelmingly white, able-bodied and male - we all need to have a voicewe are to overcome the greatest threat humanity has ever faced.Secondly, those with the broadest shoulders should contribute the most - the principle on which Taxpayers Against Poverty was founded. We cannot expect households already struggling to make ends meet to pay extra on their fuel bills to subsidise green energy.Thirdly, we need to reduce the vulnerability of those experiencing poverty to climate breakdown. This means ensuring that everyone has access to decent, well-insulated housing.  We know that the transition to a low-carbon economy will involve changes to the job market - but we have been made all too aware during the pandemic that our welfare system is not fit for purpose for those out of work. That is why we are calling for a minimum income standard, below which no-one in or out of work is allowed to fall. Calculated by the Joseph Rowntree Foundation, it is set at what the public consider to be enough for a socially acceptable standard of living. The recent energy bills crisis has shown a frightening hint of what is to come as the climate emergency takes hold - a minimum income standard would change as costs do, paid for by a tax on the very wealthiest in our society. Climate breakdown will affect everyone, but not everyone will be equally affected. We need our leaders to act now to ensure that both unchecked carbon emissions and queues for soup kitchens become a thing of the past. title: uks most instagrammable christmas market
story: UKs most Instagrammable Christmas market tonext weekend - with millions set to visitManchester Christmas Market has been crowned the most gram-worthy festive market in the UK - and their popular market mugs are back this yearManchesters Christmas market Image: Getty ImagesByBethan ShufflebothamNiche Writer:,  Nov | commentsTwinkly lights, hot chocolate with cream and dozens of independent businesses stocking perfect Christmas presents - that’s right, Christmas markets are back for . Festive fans were left devastated in  when many Christmas markets across the UK were cancelled due to lockdown restrictions. Organisers are gearing up for a year set to be bigger and better than ever - with millions of shoppers planning to hit city squares for street food and festive fun.But did you really go to the Christmas marketsyou didn’t post it on Instagram Design Bundles has scoured social media to find the most Instagrammable Christmas market in the UK - and it starts next weekend.With over , hashtags on the photo sharing app, Manchester Christmas Market is the most posted about on the social media app, suggesting it’s got the most photo opportunities and prettiest scenery.  This year, the market opens on Friday, November , running to Wednesday, December  - and has seen more than nine million visitors a year throughout the festive period in previous years. Guests will be delighted to know that the Manchester Christmas Market mugs are back, but for the first time ever, they’ll be dateless, having originally been designed for . Visitors can get their hands on a mug when buying a hot drink in the market, and will be asked to pay a £ deposit. Shoppers can eitherthe mug for the deposit, of keep it as a souvenir.Wondering where to eat, drink or visit for your next UK holiday  At Chill we help you decide where to go and stay next with hundreds of recommendations right on your doorstep. Visit our brilliant new website chill and start packing. If youaposd also like weekly inspiration and advice for your next trip, you can sign up to the Chill newsletter here. For the latest must-have travel news follow us on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter.Eager to make up for missed celebrations, Manchester will also playing host to a family-friendly Winter Gardensattraction, which will be open until Bank Holiday Monday, January .The world-famous market will be located in six of the city squares, each offering dferent festive stalls and activities, including St Ann’s Square, Exchange Square, New Cathedral Street, King Street, Market Street and Cathedral Gardens. And of course, Manchester’s Giant Santa will take pride of place in the city centre, along with a trail of light sculptures taking visitors on an illuminated trip around the city.  The Christmas market with the second highest number of hashtags is Edinburgh, with , - last year it welcomed .million visitors despite the pandemic. Bath Christmas Market had the third highest number of hashtags at ,, but has been cancelled for  due to the pandemic. Instead a virtual ‘event’ will replace the in-person festivities.  Organisers have encouraged shoppers to continue supporting small businesses despite the physical market not going ahead. They said: “Although Bath Christmas Market  is cancelled, there’s still plenty of ways to get into the Christmas spirit throughout November and December including paying a visit to a wonderful group of our Artisan makers by Bath Abbey, exploring Bath with a city-wide illuminations trail, festive entertainment and so much more.” London’s famous Winter Wonderland, held in Hyde Park, ranked as the fourth most Instagrammable Christmas Market in the UK. The attraction has an Instagram hashtag count of ,, and after being cancelled last year due to the pandemic, is set to be the longest running Christmas fair in the UK, opening on November  until January , , providing plenty of time to get Instagram pictures. title: woman horrified after online date
story: Woman horried after online date threatens to rape her in vile messageBecca McFarlane, , from Dumbarton in Scotland, had agreed to go for a drink with the man but was horried after receiving a threatening message on social mediaBecca McFarlane was horried by the messageByKirsty FeerickJournalist:,  Nov A woman was left in tears after an Instagram date aposthreatened to rape herapos in a vile message online. Becca McFarlane, , from Dumbarton in Scotland, had exchanged messages with the man on several occasions on the social media .They had agreed to go for a drink, the Daily Record reports, but she was horried after she received a disturbing message.She said the man told hershe came near him wearing the outfit she had on in her Instagram pictures, he would rape her. The sickening message says: Iaposve thought about you when w****** lol put it this way seeyou came anywhere near me with that outfit you wore with the skirt and stockings youaposd be getting raped.  Becca told the Daily Record: “It made me burst out crying and I was incredibly anxious for the rest of the day. “I don’t understand, even thinking it is disgusting, never mind typing it out and pressing send. “We had chatted a few times and he seemed nice at first. “He askedI would be up for getting a drink with him sometime, I said yes and he followed with those messages. “I can only count myself as ‘lucky’ that he said that before I actually met him. Shaken Becca blocked the man on social media and reported the messages to the police.  She says the incident has left her extremely anxious to meet men online in the future. She added: I’m definitely more scared to meet men online. This has given me a fright. aposI don’t deserve to be threatened with sexual violence for the way I dress. I think it’s absolutely abhorrent men think they can speak to a woman like that. Becca says she is lucky the man showed his true colours before she went to meet him in person. She is urging other women to come forward and report similar incidents. She added: In today’s society, men think they can say whatever they want behind a phone screen. I doubt he would have said it to my face. With the recent spikings in Scottish venues, I would encourage women to come forward and report these things. Itaposs definitely worth it. A Police Scotland spokesperson said: “Officers are investigating a report of threatening communications via social media which was reported to police in Dumbarton on Monday,  November, .Most ReadFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Daily RecordRapePolice Scotland" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: family left divided after birthday
story: I dont want any meat at my birthday but my parents are ignoring my wishesAround  guests, all friends and family, had been invited to a young womans birthday party and as she is a vegan, she stipulated that only plant-based food would be servedThe birthday girl said that she wanted the whole menu to be vegan Image: Getty ImagesByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsA vegan woman had ided her family by insisting that only plant-based food be served at her birthday meal - despite more than  guests attending. The anonymous -year-old girl said that her family had organised a large birthday party for when she turns , and had invited scores of people to attend - and booked a banquet hall to host them all. The girl said that she had been a strict vegan for more than two years, and decided that she only wanted plant-based food served on her big day - despite the non-vegan guests. But now her family have been left ided and her parents are in the firing line, as some guests didnapost seem happy about the lack of meat on the menu. What do you think about the all vegan menu  Let us know in the comments...Taking to Reddit, the woman said: I have been a strict vegan for over two years now. I am doing it because I believe in animal rights and I know what the meat industry does to the environment. I will not be part of the problem. We are catering food for this party and I explicitly said that since it’s my birthday party I want the entire menu to be vegan. My parents said they will order any vegan dishes I want, but will also provide non-vegan dishes to accommodate other guests. I am not happy with this.It’s my birthday party and one of my requests is that people not consume animals for this one night - it’s one night, it’s not that big of a deal.My parents are not budging and saying that not everyone is vegan and they need stuff to eat, but it’s my birthday party - I don’t think it’s going to kill anyone to have to eat vegan for the night. After sharing her story online, other Reddit users were quick to comment their opinion - and some picked fault with her logic. One said: I am so far from vegan, you’d probably hate me. That being said, I love vegetarian and vegan food. I don’t even have meat every day. No one will die for going one meal without meat and animal products. It is your birthday party and everyone can enjoy the food that is provided. People who complain that they didn’t get a proper meal without a big old steak or deep-fried chicken are absolutely narrow-minded.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. And another wrote: Your parents are being pretty generous catering for  people for a th birthday. With that amount of investment, they deserve to have some say in the menu. You are ok to have preferences here… but ultimatelyit’s on their dime, they should make the call. If you disagree, feel free to pay for it yourself. While a third added: If one of your meat-eating friends was to throw the same party and invite you, would you expect them to have some vegan options for you Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. title: strange ufo seen floating across
story: Strange UFO seen floating across city sky leaves people scratching their headsLynsey Currie said her boyfriend filmed the UFO as it floated in the sky above his flat in the Maryhill area of GlasgowThe mystery sighting was made recently in GlasgowByHolly LennonWilliam WalkerNews Reporter:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsFootage of an apparent aposUFOapos has left people scratching their heads after the mysterious object was filmed above a flat in Glasgow. Lynsey Currie said her boyfriend had filmed the mystery object above his flat in the Maryhill area of the city.She told Glasgow Live it was aposflying across the sky going from the northwest of Glasgow towards the southwestapos.The video footage appears to show an unidentied object floating across the city skyline, but what exactly the shape is remains a mystery.What do you think  Is it a UFO or something a little more terrestrial  Let us know in the comments.The latest sighting isnapost the first suspected UFO that has been documented in recent weeks.In Springfield, Missouri one man claimed to have seen a mysterious rotating metallic cube-shaped object in the sky. Justin Johnson spotted something he just couldnapost explain hovering over some shops in the city. The -year-old said it left him spooked - and others have come forward with similar experiences. And last month it was revealed that Yorkshire is a aposhot bedapos for UFO encounters after hundreds were reported in the past two decades alone. In September, a strange triangular light moved across the night sky over Kingston-upon-Hull in Humberside. In August a large orange glowing ball of light around ft high was spotted moving north to south in a smooth motion at about . at night in Otley. And the same month in Pontefract four black objects were seen in a diamond formation travelling upwards and slowly out of view at around : at night. Across the UK in just March and April  alone there were  UFO sighting recorded in the country - up  per cent from . news weird-news woman-gets-huge-tattoo-boyfriends-"Girls MASSIVE tattoo of ex boyfriends nameByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Nov | comments A young woman found herself questioning her decisions and living in regret after getting a huge tattoo of her boyfriendaposs name - as the pair broke up just a week later. TikTok star Ashlyn Grace, , got the massive tattoo across her whole back, with the letters trailing down from the base of her neck to the bottom of her spine.In huge letters, the name Alexander is now permanently inked on Ashlynaposs back - which she now regrets, as the pair broke up just one week after she got the tattoo. After sharing the news on TikTok, Ashlyn was soon inundated with comments as her video went viral, and many said the tattoo was the biggest theyaposd ever seen.What do you think of the tattoo  Let us know in the comments...In the video, Ashlyn said: Donapost be alarmed, itaposs a little big. I donapost think thereaposs a smart way to do this but, yep, I understood the assignment. The tattoo, written in a gothic font, sparked an intense reaction from other TikTok users who were shocked by what they saw. One said: Girl thataposs the biggest name tattoo I did ever see. While another wrote: Thataposs gonna be an awkward convo for the next guy. And a third added: The tattoo artists that did this needs to be put in federal prison. Just get another boyfriend with the same name, joked a fourth TikTok fan. Other users had aposhelpfulapos advice, and suggested that Ashlyn should turn her back into a giant word search.For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere.Ashlyn could consider getting the tattoo covered up, but she should probably avoid amateur tattooists - as one recently went viral after sharing her first-ever inking. TikTok star Sam, @descendantofsalemwitches, dreams of one day becoming a professional tattoo artist - but she might have some way to go.She recently completed her first tattoo on a real-le person, and unveiled it in a TikTok video that has since gone viral, receiving over five million views. It also received countless comments, mostly from people urging Sam to quit - saying she should have practised more before committing to tattooing someone.Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. title: woman tears after being reunited
story: Woman in tears after being reunited with lost love letters from soldier  years laterChy Brown from New York collects antiques and tracks down their rightful owners, with the most recent discovery being -year-old love letters that she found in a flea market Image: Jam Press Vid @citychicdecorByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsA woman has reunited s love letters from a soldier with his lover, bringing her to tears. Chy Brown, , from New York City, US, spotted the letters at a local flea market and decided to track down the recipient – who was nicknamed aposCookieapos in the letters. The romantic notes were signed by aposBobbyapos, who appears to have been a soldier at the time, who tells his lover that he is thinking of her and sending love, as well as keeping her up to date with his goings-on.Chy, who regularly trawls charity shops and flea markets to find heirlooms that she can , couldn’t use the census to track down the address, so she took to Google to find Cookie’s real name.After finding her on MyHeritage, she saw she had close family and was possibly still alive.For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. The blogger then contacted a close cousin of Cookie, who she was able to send the letters to. I saw them in the flea market and instantly knew these were something special, Chy said. I always pick up love lettersthey have a name or address on them. This was the first time I was able to give back an item directly to someone who was still living versus a descendant or close family member. I normally pick up items over  years old, but I can’t turn away from love letters. What makes these even more special is that the recipient never received the letters in the first place.” Cookie was thrilled to be given the lost letters – which she had never received. Her cousin said: Cookie was an airline hostess in New York back then. She remembers this person and she’s in tears, according to my mom, who was FaceTiming her. Cookie said she is enjoying reading the letters with a big smile. Chy, originally from Washington DC, has made ing heirlooms from flea markets a hobby and she has sent back around  antiques to the closest family member alive.Scrolling through public family trees on Ancestry, Chy is more often than not able to reunite the objects with their owner’s descendants.  Chy added: My dad is a genealogist and growing up I saw him help families from around the world for free, not only help them with finding heritage but also help them fill in the missing pieces of their family history. Because I am an interior decorator, I thrt often and it always broke my heart seeing a family heirloom in some box at the flea market instead of with its rightful family. One day I just decided to use what I know of genealogy, what my dad taught me, and to use it to trace the items that I find at thrts and flea markets back. Once I started I never stopped. I try and stay in contact with as many people to who Iaposve ed heirlooms to as possible! Despite some of the heirlooms costing hundreds to buy and post, Chy never asks for a cent from the family members she s the items to. Cha said: I spend my own money on this and postage and never ask for repayment from families. I have spent well over , as NYC flea markets are a bit expensive. I’ve also spent hundreds on postage.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: women only just finding out
story: Women are only just finding out why there’s a bow on the front of knickersHaving a bow on the front of knickers may make it easier to tell the front from the back, but thats not the only reason it features on underwear - do you know what it is  Image: Getty Images iStockphotoByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsAt some point, you all would have noticed a small decorative bow sewn at the level of virtually every pair of womenaposs briefs. Beyond that, it isnapost something that many of us can admit to thinking long and hard about. Have you ever wondered why that was  Neither had we... but apparently there are a few reasons for it. Knickers were first introduced during the Renaissance to maintain hygiene, to protect women from the cold and to save them from aposembarrassmentaposthey fell off a horse. But when did bows begin to feature on them, and why  One intrigued person took to Reddit to get to the bottom of the mystery.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Why do so many panties have that little bow on the centre front  Where did the tradition come from  they asked, and a number of people were quick to share their assumptions. The most common reason was that the bow kept underwear from falling down as elastic was yet to be invented. One person commented: Now  Because itaposs cute, itaposs feminine, it evokes innocence, and it makes it really easy to tell which side is the front when dressing hastily in the dark.  As for the roots of the tradition  It comes from pre-elastic days when your underthings were held in place by a bit of ribbon threaded through the eyelet lace at the tops. The little bow is where you tied that ribbon, and of course, itaposs in the front because thataposs the easiest place to do something like that. But this isnapost the only reason. Centuries ago, before electricity was invented, women would often have to get up before dawn and dress in the dark, or by candlelight. So, the bow was used to distinguish the front from the back. Now, the piece of ribbon is seen more as a decoration. Another person said: I always wondered what that damn bow was there for. I always found them a bit stupid but I learned to ignore them. Itaposs interesting to know why they were there to begin with . Holy s**t you just blew my mind, said a third. Others admitted they always remove the bows themselves, with one person commenting: I always take them off. While another said: Theyaposre really annoying. I always tear them off. Did you know this Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: cleo smith suspect obsessed dolls
story: Cleo Smith suspect obsessed with dolls as picture shows him with Bratz figuresTerence Darrell Kelly, , has been charged "with ious offences" relating to the abduction of Cleo Smith - he has appeared in Magistrates CourtLocal Australian sites have pictured the suspect holding Bratz dollsByDanya BazaraaSenior News Reporter:,  Nov The man accused of abducting Cleo Smith before she was found in a locked house by police is allegedly obsessed with dolls.Cleo, four, went missing for over two weeks before being found in a property in Australia. Terence Darrell Kelly, , has been charged with ious offences relating to the abduction. He was taken into custody shortly after Cleo was found in a property early on Wednesday and has been charged on Thursday.Now local sites in Australia have pictured Kelly holding Bratz dolls while wearing a t-shirt that says aposBratzapos on it.He allegedly created fake social media profiles with photos of his doll collection. When questioned over Kellyaposs alleged obsession with dolls and whether he may have used them to lure Cleo, police said they would not be commenting, reports the Daily Mail. After charging the suspect, police said in a statement: The charges include one count of forcibly take a child under  . Given this matter is now before the court, police are unable to make any further comment on the charges at this stage, the force said.Kelly did not apply for bail and was not required to enter a plea when he appeared in Carnarvon Magistrateaposs Court today, local reports said.  He was remanded in custody until December .ABC News reported that Kelly did not show much emotion except for seeming agitated with the presence of two of their journalists.Kelly was twice taken to hospital for self-inflicted injuries after his arrest and was earlier pictured in an ambulance with his head in bandages. He reportedly suffered head injuries while he was in a holding cell and was taken to hospital by police. Cleo went missing from an outback campsite  days before she was found safe in a locked house.  There is still a lot of work to do ... the investigation continues, Rod Wilde, a detective superintendent in the state of Western Australia, told an earlier media conference. Cleo had last been seen in her familyaposs tent in the early hours of October  at the remote Blowholes Shacks campsite in Macleod, triggering an extensive search by land and aerial crews, along with roadblocks and CCTV footage. She was found safe on Wednesday when police broke into a house in Carnarvon, a town about  kmsouth of the campsite on the far northwest coast of the state. The house is just  kmfrom her family home, Australian media said. On Thursday, police released an audio recording of their entry into the house and the discovery of the girl in a room. Weaposve got her. Weaposve got her, an officer could be heard saying.After being asked her name a few times, the toddler answered, My name is Cleo.She had been playing with dolls with the light on at the time, police said.  After meeting her family, state Premier Mark McGowan said Cleo was a very bright, upbeat, sweet little girl and looked very well adjusted, considering her ordeal. Specialist child interviewers would speak with her, and authorities had instructed her parents on how to talk to her to preserve her memory, authorities said. The hashtag CleoSmith has been trending on Twitter since Wednesday, with a picture posted by police that showed a smiling Cleo waving from her hospital bed drawing nearly , likes. Purple and pink balloons adorned the streets and many landmarks in Perth, the capital of Western Australia, were lit up in blue on Wednesday night to thank police for their efforts. Ms Smith was adamant that her daughter could not have left the tent by herself, instantly leading to fears that she had been abducted. title: major coal using polluting nations
story: Major coal-using polluting nations snub COP drive to end  years of fossil fuelThe US, China, Australia and India are missing from a COP pledge to stop increasing the domestic use of coal - Ed Miliband said the Government has let others off the hookMiner Mohammad Ismail, , digs in a coal mine in Choa Saidan Shah, Punjab province, Pakistan Image: XByNada FarhoudEnvironment editor:,  Nov | commentsSome of the world’s biggest coal-using economies have failed to sign up to a major deal announced at Cop. Shadow Business Secretary Ed Miliband slammed “glaring gaps” in tackling fossil fuels as the US, China, Australia and India were missing from a pledge to stop increasing domestic use of coal. But more than  countries have agreed to phase out the use of coal for electricity including Canada, Poland, South Korea, Ukraine, Indonesia and Vietnam. Bigger economies plan to do so in the s, with others following in the s. But experts warn for the world to stay within .C of warming, the phase-out should happen before . Coal is the single worst climate change offender, and consigning it to history has been a focus for the UK as host of the UN summit.Have your say on this story in the comment section UK Business ­Secretary Kwasi Kwarteng said “the end of coal is in sight” and described the announcement as “a milestone moment in our global efforts to tackle climate change”. But Mr Miliband said there was nothing on phasing out oil and gas, and warned the Government “has let others off the hook”. Coal produced more than a third of the world’s ­electricity in . South Africa, Poland and India need major investments to clean up their energy sectors. Signatories have agreed to end all investment in new coal power generation domestically and internationally. But these commitments are not binding. More than  nations – including the US, the UK and Denmark – said they will stop funding fossil fuel development overseas by the end of . But Jamie Peters, of Friends of the Earth, said: “Coal is basically allowed to continue as normal for years yet.” Greenpeace’s Juan Pablo Osornio said: “This statement falls well short of the ambition needed in this critical decade.” El Gündüzyeli, of Climate Action Network Europe, added: “This is not a game-changer.” Comment MORE ON GreenpeaceUnited NationsFriends of the EarthEd MilibandEnergyClimate changePoliticsCOP" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: man eaten piranhas after jumping
story: Man eaten by piranhas after jumping into lake to escape swarm of beesThe horror incident happened on Saturday in a rural area of Brasilandia de Minas, a municipality in the state of Minas Gerais in Brazil around  miles north-west of Rio de JaneiroAbout  species of piranhas inhabit South America’s lakes and rivers. File image Image: Getty ImagesByNatalia PenzaWilliam WalkerNews Reporter:,  Nov | commentsA man died after jumping into a lake to escape a swarm of bees only to be attacked by piranhas. The -year-old was fishing with two friends by the shoreline of a lake in Brazil when they were targeted by the insects. All three jumped into the piranha-infested water but one of them was unable to get out and drowned. Specialist ers found his face, his ears and part of his body had lacerations left by the killer fish after recovering it around  feet from the shoreline. The horror incident happened on Saturday in a rural area of Brasilandia de Minas, a municipality in the state of Minas Gerais in Brazil around  miles north-west of Rio de Janeiro.  The -year-old victim, whose body was recovered a day after the man went missing when ers with specialist equipment were mobilised, has not yet been named. His family have been given permission to bury his body after investigators ruled a tragic accident had occurred and there was no sign of any crime. It has not been made clear whether the fisherman drowned before he was attacked by piranhas or the fish played a part in his death by preventing him swimming to safety like his two friends. One of the pals was the owner of the land where the tragedy occurred. The municipality is now home to around , people and boasts a tropical climate with temperatures ranging from  to  degrees Celsius. Around  species of piranhas are said to inhabit South America’s lakes and rivers. They have one of the strongest bites found in bony fishes thanks to their large jaw muscles attached closely to the tip of the jaw. Swimming near fishermen is said to increase the risk of attacks due to the commotion caused by the struggling fish and the presence of bait in the water. Nearly  piranha attacks, all involving single bites to the feet, were reported in the first half of  in an articial lake near the city of Palmas in central Brazil. .dct-cta__grid:after.dct-cta--signup .dct-cta__label,.dct-cta--signup .dct-cta__btn.dct-cta--signup .dct-cta__gridgrid-template-columns:fr minmaxgrid-gap:.rem .remSince the October holidays, some north and north east councils are dealing with #signicant outbreaks# of Covid- in schools and absence rates have spiked across the region.The islands have been hit particularly hard since the holiday break, according to the most recent covid related school absence rates.The Comhairle nan Eilean Siar reported Covid- outbreaks at two schools since the October holidays. The island council is experiencing its highest rate of covid related school absences since September .Orkney Islands Council reported  cases at a local primary school.Highland Council reported #signicant outbreaks# at two schools and covid related absence rates are up this week in all mainland local authorities.Since the emergence of the Delta iant and the start of the new school year, councils and local NHS officials are reporting that most cases at school are the result of community spread.On the mainland Highlandand Morayhave the next highest rates. Aberdeenshire Council#s school holidays were scheduled a week later than most other councils, so there are not as many statistics available since the start of the second term.The Covid absence rates continue to be sporadic in the island schools. Small pupil rolls cause pronounced changes in the case of an outbreak or a missing report. The highest rate of covid related school absences is in the Western Isles, with .% of students out due to covid as of November .The rate in the Western Isles typically hovers around % or below, but experienced a similar spike at the beginning of the school year and hit a high of almost % during an outbreak in . Orkney sits at .% and the rate in Shetland is currently .%.Although councils dfer on their terminology, the NHS uses the term #outbreak# to refer to two or more confirmed cases at the same setting within a -day period. But this does not always mean that the cases were transmitted on-site or in-class.A Highland Council spokeswoman said that multiple schools have more than one Covid- case, as of November .She added that there are #signicant outbreaks of the virus at Avoch Primary School and Mount Pleasant Primary School. Schools are communicating with all parents carers under the guidance of NHS Health Protection Team.#On Wednesday, the council put a two-week hold on community activities at Avoch Primary School. This was in response to the #signicant increase of Covid- cases within the school community.#A spokesman for the Comhairle nan Eilean Siar reported outbreaks at two schools since the October holidays.#There has been a rise in staff and pupil absence since the holidays as a direct result of a higher prevalence of virus transmission and resultant infection and self-isolation.#At Papdale Primary School in Orkney, council officials recently advised parents and carers of a potential Covid- situation. A council spokeswoman reported  positive cases at Papdale # out of  pupils # as of November .She added that the school is still open and NHS Orkney Public Health is monitoring the situation.A spokesperson from Moray Council said that, while there are some positive cases, there are no outbreaks at schools in Moray.After a spike in Covid- cases in young people to begin the school year, hundreds of parents across the north and north east decided it was safer for their children at home.But the most recent statistics show that at least some of those students are beginning toto class.Since the beginning of the pandemic and the first school lockdown in , parents have been split over the issue of restrictions in schools. A recent PJ poll revealed that % of , respondents are against face masks in schools.Advocacy groups like UFT Scotland say that restrictions are proving detrimental to students# education and social development. They argue that these outweigh the risks of infection.But at the same time, a coalition of parent groups are advocating for more Covid- mitigation measures in Scottish schools.The groups think that bringing back isolation protocol for classroom contacts and other measures could make schools safer.The Scottish Government recently suggested that in-school safety measures, including masks, could remain in place through the winter.First Class : Primary  photos from schools across the north and north-east PART Parents to save £ in free school meals expansionNursery inspection reports: What the inspectors think of north and north east childcare

.dct-cta__grid:after.dct-cta--signup .dct-cta__label,.dct-cta--signup .dct-cta__btn.dct-cta--signup .dct-cta__gridgrid-template-columns:fr minmaxgrid-gap:.rem .remIn-form striker Christian Ramirez can force his way back into the United States squad, believes Aberdeen boss Stephen Glass.Capped twice by his country, the -year-old last featured for the USA in February .Ramirez has nine goals already this season for Aberdeen and Glass reckons thatmust put him back on USA boss Gregg Berhalter’s radar.The United States have two World Cup qualiers this month and Berhalter has yet to name his squad.The Stars and Stripes host group leaders Mexico in Cincinatti on November  before facing Jamaica away four days later.United States sit second in their group with the top three automatically qualying for World Cup .Glass reckons Ramirez’s cap bid and World Cup dream can be achievedhe continues scoring for the Dons.Glass said: “I think any player that scores goals makes any international manager make decisions.‘Christian has been doing that.“We obviously believe how good he is.“That’s why we brought him here.“He’s proving himself to us, but there’s a huge amount of competition at the top end of the park for the United States.“You’ll be well aware of some of the names who play for them.“But he is going to be hungry to be involved in a World Cup year. Of course he is.“Andhe keeps scoring goals, I don’t see why not.”The United States are on a high having won the CONCOCAF Gold Cup on August  with a - defeat of Mexico in the final in Nevada.Ramirez made a scoring international debut in Berhalter’s first game in charge of United States in a - friendly defeat of Panama on January , .Dubbed #Superman# during his time at Minnesota United, Ramirez  was last capped for his country in a - friendly defeat of Costa Rica on February ,  when featuring as a second half substitute.United States have also arranged a friendly against Bosnia-Herzegovina on December  at the LA Galaxy’s Dignity Health Sports Park.However, that is likely to be a two-week camp for MLS players as there is a -week break between the end of the MLS season and the next World Cup qualiers.Aberdeen face Hibs at Easter Road on the same day as that friendly.United States boss Berhalter has selected Brenden Aaronson , Timothy Weah , Gyasa Zardesand -year-old sensation Ricardo Pepito lead the attack in his previous two squads.Ramirez took a pay cut to move to Aberdeen from MLS side Houston Dynamo on a two-year contract in the summer to reignite his career.The Calornian made an immediate impact with a goal on his debut in the - Europa League defeat of Bk Hacken.Beginning his Pittodrie career with a bang, Ramirez netted four goals in his first four games.mdash Aberdeen FCOctober , However, the goals dried up with just one more in the next  games as Aberdeen endured a winless slump they have now emerged from with seven points from the last three games against Hearts, Rangers and Hibs.Ramirez revealed in the aftermath of the - defeat of Hibs, where he scored the winner, that he and his we had received messages of criticism during that goal drought.Now back in form, Ramirez has netted in four of the last six league games.Glass said:  “I think he’s getting a lot more help from his team-mates.“Christian looks like he’s got a belief that he can score again.“To be fair to him, I think he was getting a lot of things pointed at him about not scoring.“People were adding a game on every week when he didn’t score and you get hit with that stat after every game and before the next one.“We’ve never lost belief in him.“I don’t think he’s ever lost belief in himself either.“In terms of his goalscoring, he’s right up there.”

title: star return to league action with victory
story: Colin CameronUpdated:   , : pmLikeGoogle +TweetEmailWant to  We value our content, so access to our full site is only available on subscription.Your subscription entitles you to -day-a-week access to our website, plus a full digital copy of that week#s paper to read on your pc mac or mobile device.And there#s more # your subscription includes access to digital archive copies from  onwards.RJD-sponsored Red Star travelled to Ballerup, East Kilbride on Saturday October  to play their first league game since February  and ed home with three points after an excellent overall performance.The visitors started the game on the front foot and could have been ahead after three minutes when Fraser Talbot#s long range effort came crashing back off the bar.Star didn#t have long to wait before they opened the scoring, however, as Stuart MacLean reacted quickest to a slip in the Duncanrig defence to put his side ahead four minutes later.Talbot again came close to his first Red Star goal but was denied by the crossbar for the second time after finding space to shoot in the box.The lead was doubled soon after when Aaron Moore linked up well with Stuart MacLean on the right channel and powered his shot through the hands of the Duncanrig keeper.Star had several chances to make the game safe in the opening half hour with Craig Aitken and Andy Weir providing the ammunition from the wide areas but the final touch was slightly lacking.Coll McCallum was next to rattle the bar as his long-range effort took a bizzare bounce over the keeper#s head but the woodwork was once again kind to the hosts.Duncanrig pulled themselves back into the game with a rare attack which saw Star switch off and concede a disappointing goal as the midfielder was able to burst through the Star spine unchallenged to leave Ally Lewis with no chance.This stung Star back into action and the two-goal cushion was restored before the break when an excellent counter-attack saw Talbot lay a perfectly weighted pass into the path of Aitken, who finished with great composure to give Star a - lead at half time.Star looked to put the game to bed as quickly as possible in the second half and did so as Aaron Moore grabbed his second of the afternoon following a slip from the Duncanrig keeper.MacLean was next to double his tally as he proved too sharp for the Duncanrig defence and finished well from a tight angle to make the score - with half an hour to go.This gave manager Weir the chance to ring the changes, with Ryan Caskie coming on to replace Aaron Moore and helping himself to two goals of his own from close range to make the final score -.The only sour note was an injury to goal-scoring substitute Caskie which will rule him out of Star#s next game.Star look to make it back-to-back wins on Saturday October , again on their travels to Port Glasgow OBU.

title: darcy-graham-set-20th-cap-bt-murrayfield-saturday
story: FORMER Hawick player Darcy Graham has been selected for Scotlandrsquos opening match of the  Autumn Nations Series against Tonga at BT Murrayfield on Saturday  October ndash kick-off :pm.This will be the Edinburgh flyer Grahamrsquos th international appearance having earned his first cap coming off the bench against Wales in Cardf for the Doddie Weir Cup in November .He starts at full-back and is joined in the back three by Glasgow duo Kyle Steyn, who will add to his single cap won against France in the last match at BT Murrayfield played in front of crowds in March , and Rufus McLean who will make his first Scotland start.Joining McLean on Scotland debut will be clubmate Sione Tuipulotu who lines up with fellow Glasgow Warrior Sam Johnson as the centre partnership.Co-Captain and Lions scrum-half Ali Price teams up with Edinburghrsquos Blair Kinghorn at fly-half to form a brand new half-back pairing.In the pack fellow British  Irish Lions Zander Fagerson starts at tighthead prop with Hamish Watson at openside flanker, as they feature for Scotland for the first time since the South Africa tour this summer.Edinburgh Rugbyrsquos Jamie Ritchie, also named as Co-Captain, packs down on the blindside of the scrum which is anchored by Glasgow Warriorsrsquo Matt Fagerson at number eight.Youth and experience combine in the second row which sees Rob Harley earn his rd cap for Scotland and joined by Edinburgh lock Jamie Hodgson, who will win his first cap.Up front George Turner starts at hooker with Fagerson and with a debutant on the loose-head side in Edinburgh Rugbyrsquos Pierre Schoeman.Edinburgh Rugby provide forward replacements on debut in the form of lock Marshall Sykes and back-row Luke Crosbie.Glasgow Warriors half-back partners Jamie Dobie and Ross Thompson are the uncapped backs.Former Scotland Captain Stuart McInally is available off the bench alongside Glasgow props Jamie Bhatti and Oli Kebble in the front row, with backrow forward Nick Haining of Edinburgh completing the matchday squad..removeScotland Head Coach Gregor Townsend said: ldquoAs a playing and coaching group we are looking forward to ing to international rugby over the coming four weeks in the Autumn Nations Series.ldquoThis week has been our first opportunity since the Six Nations to come together as a team, and our goal is to become a better team over the next month. Saturday will also be a huge occasion for a number of players in our squad who have the honour of playing for their country for the first time.ldquoTonga will be very dangerous opponents for us, as they pose a ferocious physical challenge in attack and defence. They performed very well on their last visit to Scotland and Irsquom sure they will be highly motivated to take the game to us once again.

title: excellent-performances-gala-harriers-scone-palace
story: A NUMBER of runners from Gala Harriers took part in the Scottish National Cross-Country Relays at Scone Palace on Saturday.Kirsty Rankinegot off to a great start over the fast .k course to hand over to Erin Grayin th. Erin had an excellent run, pulling the girls back to th, leaving U Isla Paterson for the final leg. This brought the girls home in a very well-deserved th. In this event, Gala also fielded an incomplete team ndash with Kacie Brownand Poppy Lunngetting their first taste of national relays and running very well at this level of competition.Next up were the boys. A total of  teams toed the starting line and Archie Dalgliesh set off for the Us, fighting his way through the field and handing over to U Zico Field in th. Zico had a strong run and pulled back a few places to th, leaving Ewan Christie for what was possibly the Gala run of the day. He charged through the field and held on for a fantastic th overall  The second Gala team ndash consisting of Charlie Dalgliesh, Ross Christie and Cameron Rankine ndash also ran strongly and finished th overall.The Senior and Masters teams raced over a scenic km loop.Three teams featured for Gala in the omens race. The A team were given a great start by Sara Green with a strong opening leg of : minutes. Fantastic support was then provided by Lizzie Macleish , Lisa Dalglieshand Charlotte Hendryfor a th place finish overall.On paper the W team looked to be well-balanced with strong runners in all positions and so it proved. Gill Lunn , Pamela Baillieand Katy Bardencombined for th place overall ndash just over  seconds outside of the medal spots.The highlight of the day for the Gala team was a bronze-medal winning performance from the W team. Terric performances from Julie Johnstone , Lindsay Dunand Carole Fortuneproved good enough for rd place.The M team of Gary Trewartha , Brian Aitchison , Graeme Murdochand Wayne Mcintoshgave their all and left the course happy and with a bronze medal around their necks. However, subsequent revisions to the results relegated the team to th place in the M category..removeDarrell Hastie led the senior mens team out in typically fast fashion with a : minute leg. The baton was then passed to Fergus Johnston , Paul Hendersonand Iain Buckley , resulting in th place overall. club.The forever-young Bob Johnson completed the teams efforts running a solid solo leg in :.

title: peebles-man-lost-father-covid-formed-ppe-company
story: AN INTERNATIONAL company formed by a Peebles man in the wake of the pandemic to manufacture vital PPE has sponsored local National Hunt Jockey Ryan Mania.Cameron lsquoCammyrsquo Young felt the brunt of the global pandemic early on when he tragically lost his father to COVID-.Further impacting him, his mother was then hospitalised only one month later but has since made a full recovery.Having seen first-hand the overwhelming effects of this disease, Cameron decided to put together a plan to make a dference.In just a few months, it became apparent that the lack of PPE in Scotland and hospitals all over the world was becoming a signicant problem and he decided to step in and be a part of the solution.He founded Envelicus Ltd an international firm focused on the manufacturing of Nitrile and Latex gloves.Utilizing a factory-direct model, Envelicus has established capacity contracts and partnerships with some of the best factories in the world for global production and distribution.The Envelicus mission is ldquoPutting gloves on the hands of the people who need them.With strong ties to the region, Envelicus decided to sponsor Borders jockey Ryan Mania.The pair met during their time as common riding principles in  and have remained good friends.

title: massive-game-vale-raydale-park
story: VALE OF Leithen face arguably their biggest game in years this Saturday when they take on fellow Lowland League strugglers Gretna at Raydale Park.The Dumfries and Galloway side, who replaced manager Rowan Alexander with Stephen Hatfield last month, are currently six points ahead of Vale.New Vale head coach Grant Sandison is looking forward to the challenge after witnessing signs of encouragement against Edinburgh University in his first game in charge.After a string of heavy defeats, the club, with four new faces in the starting line-up, limited the students to three goals.But the Innerleithen side created a number of chances of their own and were unlucky to go in at half-time one goal down.Sandison told the Peeblesshire News: ldquoI was happy with the first-half performance against Edinburgh University."We set up to be organised and to stop conceding goals and I think we limited them to one shot before they scored from a direct free kick just before half-time. We created two or three good chances but in the second half we conceded early from a mistake and then ran out of steam but overall I was happy with the performance.ldquoWe had four players making their debut, Andrew Mackay, Ben Viola and Lewis Grahame who all signed from Penicuik and Ben Brady, who had just been released by St Mirren played as a trialist.ldquoBenpicked up an injury the second-half and had to go off. Hersquos had issues with his ankle all season and went over on it. He didnrsquot train on Monday night, so wersquoll see how he is for Saturday.ldquoWe have another three players lined up that we like the look of but whether they will be signed and available for Saturday, I donrsquot know right now. Hopefully one or two may be able to play.ldquoSaturday will be a massive game for the club. The Edinburgh Uni and Gretna games probably came a bit too early for us."It would have been betterwersquod had three or four weeks with the players first, but it is what it is. I watched Gretnarsquos Scottish Cup game against Berwick Rangers and have received some reports on them but they have a new manager so their style of play may have changed..removeldquoBut Irsquove been delighted with the response of the players so far. There has been a good reaction and there was a real enthusiasm in training. I am really looking forward to the game and it would be great to claw back some points to bring back up the road.

title: ednam-pensioner-admits-involved-domestic-disturbance
story: A PENSIONER appeared in private at Jedburgh Sherf Court on Friday and admitted being involved in a domestic disturbance with his long-term partner.Seventy-three-year-old Kenneth Cooper pleaded guilty to behaving in a threatening or abusive manner at a house in the village of Ednam on Thursday.Sentence was deferred until next month for the production of background reports.Cooper, who gave an address in Galashiels, was released on bail.You might also be interested in:High Street parking issue in Borders town lsquodriving customers awayrsquo, meeting hearsRare coal mine smoke rescue helmet sells for more than pound,at Borders auctionPlans submitted to turn part of Borders mansioninto holiday accommodation

title: phenomenal-line-up-first-class-speakers-coming-borders
story: THE HOME of Sir Walter Scott opens its doors tomorrowto the Baillie Gford Borders Book Festival, bringing together a host of big names from politics, sport, history, crime and current affairs in more than  live events over six days.The Book Festival kicks off in style with a stellar line-up: Ed Balls sharing his very personal Appetite: A Memoir in Recipes of Family and Food acclaimed author of Rose Nicolson, Andrew Greig sports giants Tom English, Jim Telfer and Finlay Calder reliving the  British and Irish Lions tour of South Africa festival favourites Neil Oliver and Richard Holloway sharing their most recent works, The Story of the World in  Moments, and The Heart of Things and the BBCrsquos Gavin Esler challenging festivalgoers to consider the rise of nationalism south of the border in the FTWeekend event, Itrsquos About English, Stupid.Alistair Moffat, Festival Director, said: ldquoPutting a book festival together during a pandemic is no easy task, but we have got the most phenomenal line-up of first-class speakers and cannot wait to get our audiences along to beautul Abbotsford to give them a thoroughly intoxicating reintroduction to the live book events we have all missed so much. And of course, safety remains our key priority, so our extended -day extravaganza allows us to adhere to all Government Covid- guidelines without detracting from the sense of occasion and excitement at our .ldquoAs always, we are bringing to the Borders stars from the worlds of politics, sport, history, crime writing, acclaimed literature and current affairs. And the venue this year seems particularly fitting, given the th celebrations of Sir Walter Scott, our countryrsquos greatest-ever storyteller.ldquoIrsquom beyond excited at the prospect of six days of immersion in great writing, in all its forms, and scintillating, inspiring debate -- in person!Political highlights include: Ed Miliband with his Go Big: How To Fix Our World former Prime Minister Gordon Brown on his manesto to change the world Robert Peston, straight from the Cop summit in Glasgow a unique record of history as it was made in Downing Street from Theresa Mayrsquos Chief of Staff, Gavin Barwell and the inimitable James Naughtie with his annual political round-up ..removeFor history and crime enthusiasts: Jonathan Dimbleby discusses his Barbarossa: How Hitler Lost the War Booker Prize winner, and this yearrsquos winner of the prestigious Walter Scott Prize For Historical Fiction, Hilary Mantel, makes a very special festival visit with The Mirror and the Light and crime-writing royalty Denise Mina, Ian Rankin, Ambrose Parry and Val McDermid talk about their latest novels.Sports fans have plenty to enjoy with footballing legend Pat Nevin, on his memoir The Accidental Footballer one of Scotlandrsquos finest rugby players Gavin Hastings Rory Bremner sharing classic moments of sporting commentary with his indomitable take on the likes of John Motson, Murray Walker, Peter Allis and of course Geoffrey Boycott and for something entirely dferent, Finlay Wilson with his Wild Kilted Yoga.This year, foodies can feast their ears on Great British Bake Off winner Peter Sawkins and Suzanne Mulholland, The Batch Lady, with her new and delicious ways to cook wholesome, homely food in bulk ndash perfect for an autumnal day in the Borders!Michelle McLeod, Sponsorship Manager at Baillie Gford, said: ldquoIt is fantastic to be back to live events, all in the grounds of stunning Abbotsford. The festival team have worked tirelessly to deliver this yearrsquos programme. Come along and enjoy everything the festival has to offer, including an incredible iety of events and an opportunity to hear from some of our most treasured writers.Giles Ingram, Abbotsford CEO, said: ldquoWhat a fantastic line up of authors and public figures spanning current affairs, sports, food and more, as well as my favourite theme, historical fiction. We are delighted that the Baillie Gford Borders Book Festival has chosen Abbotsford as their venue during the th anniversary year of Sir Walter Scott. Do make sure you take time to savour Scottrsquos study, where the great man sat at his desk for countless hours with quill pen in hand, dreaming up stories which still stir the imaginations of readers today. With such celebrated writers visiting us for the Book Festival, one can only imagine how excited Scott would be were he alive and at home today!The McInroy and Wood Lecture will this year feature Dailyjournalist Joe Shute exploring how, where and why our weather is changing and delivering a timely and important forecast for us all, in his Diary of the Lost Seasons.The book festival is delighted to welcome the Financial Times as its new media partner, and this yearrsquos festival programme will include FTWeekend events addressing some of the biggest political and economic issues of the day ndash Afghanistan, defining Scottishness and Englishness, and the question of a Scottish sovereign currency ndash with some of the brightest minds from the worlds of journalism, politics, economics, diplomacy and academia including Gavin Esler, Ailsa Henderson, Sebastian Payne and Sir John Kay. Lionel Barber, former editor of the Financial Times, will replace Tom Tugendhat MP, who is, unfortunately, unable to attend in-person.The weekendsees theof the always-popular Family Book Festival, sponsored by Saltire Roofing  Building, and including: Kristina Stephenson and her Museum of Marvellous Things Alan Windram and his latest One Button Benny adventure a relaxing colouring session with Eilidh Muldoon Blue Peter Award-winning Pamela Butchart with A Monster Ate My Packed Lunch! and a series of outdoor exploration events at Abbotsford, taking inspiration from Sir Walter Scott himself and his beautul home.Adults get to go free to any Family Book Festival event so long as they are accompanied by at least one child!The book festival welcomes the continued support of Title Sponsor Baillie Gford and Key Sponsor McInroy  Wood, as well as Cullen Kilshaw, Saltire Roofing  Building Ltd, Davidson Chalmers Stewart, DM Hall, and the on-going funding of Scottish Borders Council, Creative Scotland, Culture  Business Fund Scotland and EventScotland .Paul Bush OBE, Director of Events for VisitScotland, said: ldquoWe are delighted to support the Baillie Gford Borders Book Festival through Scotlandrsquos Events Recovery Fund, established by EventScotland in conjunction with funding from the Scottish Government.This -day festival, brimming with over  events, features high-profile and wide-ranging literary talent from all walks of le. The venue, Abbotsford, the home of Sir Walter Scott, is the perfect stage for this yearrsquos festival, making it even more special and celebratory for the th anniversary of Scotlandrsquos most renowned novelist.Tickets for this yearrsquos Baillie Gford Borders Book Festival are available via Citizen Ticket, at www.bordersbookfestival.org or on   .

title: said-todays-covid-update-amid-cop26
story: Humza Yousaf stood in to give the Covid update today as Nicola Sturgeon was absent from Parliament due to COP in Glasgow.The health minister provided a statement on Covid in Scotland, as thousands of people descend on Glasgow for the climate conference.In last weeks update, the First Minister warned that Covid hospitalisations were rising slightly as the virus became more prevalent in the older population.Experts have warned that Scotland could see a surge in cases following the climate summit due to the huge number of extra people in the country.However, the Scottish government has previously said it is doing everything it can to mitigate the spread of the virus during and after the conference.Heres what we learned from the Covid update today.... Covid hospitalisations still on the riseHumzaYousaf confirmed today that Covid hospitalisations are still on the rise in Scotland.people are in hospital with Covid, with  in intensive care.people were admiteed to hospital in the last week.. Decline in cases haltedThe decline in cases we saw after the summer surge has halted, hovering around , cases per day.This is likely to increase in the coming weeks as the temperature drops and people spend more time inside.. Cant rule out reintroduction of new measuresAccording to the health secretary, there are early indications that cases could begin to rise again.As a result, the Scottish government will keep in place the limited measures which remain.Humza Yousaf also added that the government could not rule out reintroducing further measures.. NHS and health system under huge pressureThe entire healthy system is under "enormous" pressure according to the health secretary.Pressures are likely to intensy over the coming weeks, particularly with COP demonstrations and bonfire night.Yousaf urged people to think sensibly and with the health service in mind when making decisions, to avoid putting further pressure on the NHS..remove. More money to help with AE waiting timesAn additional package of pound million to get AE patients to the right care as quickly as possible has been introduced by the health secretary today.This aims to avoid sending an influx of people to hospital while they are near capacity.. No more red list for international travelThe remaining countries on thered list for international travel havebeen removed.This is subject to changes, with three weekly reviews taking place in line with the UK government.These changes wereeffective from November .

title: faw-side-wind-farm-fate-settled-public-inquiry
story: A PUBLIC inquiry into a wind farm rejected by Borders councillors will be held next year.Faw Side wind farm ndash which would straddle the Borders and Dumfries and Galloway ndash was opposed by Scottish Borders Councilrsquosplanning and building standards committee in March.The fate of the project, which developers Community Windpower say could provide electricity to more than , homes, will now be settled via a public inquiry.On the inquiry, Gillian Cropper, projects director at Community Windpower, said: ldquoThe planning application in respect of Faw Side community wind farm has been referred to the DPEA and a public inquiry will be held during .:Postal worker who organised illegal rave in Borders during pandemic avoids jailldquoThis is welcomed by Community Windpower, as this onshore wind farm project can play a vital and signicant role in the action required to help tackle the climate emergency and reduce carbon emissions as Scotland works towards its legally binding net zero targets.ldquoAs world leaders attend COP in Glasgow, we are all aware that the time to act is now,we want to have any success in limiting global temperature rise to . degrees to protect the planet for future generations. This wind farm is one step towards achieving this, whilst at the same time, contributing towards a green recovery from the COVID- pandemic.SBC declared a climate emergency back in September last year.However, councillors rejected the -turbine plans this year, stating that it was not ldquothe right place for the development.Following the meeting, Ms Cropper said that local authorities ldquospeak with forked tongues, adding that ldquono one is standing up for the climate.Of the  turbines ndash the tallest of which would reach m ndash  would be situated in the Borders.:Two Borders schools recognised for educational excellencersquoMs Cropper says the project will ldquosupport at least  jobs in construction and create six permanent jobs once operational..removeShe added: ldquoFaw Side community wind farm will also provide economic investment of over pound. billion into the Borders and across Scotland over the -year le of the wind farm.South Scotland MSP Colin Smyth, of Scottish Labour, wrote a letter of objection to the government about the plans in .ldquoI am happy that there is now going to be a public inquiry about this project, he said. ldquoI expressed my objections back in  and my thoughts havenrsquot changed.ldquoWhile a number of constituents had contacted me about the lack of proper consultation about the project, this wasnrsquot the only issue.:Coronavirus: Data shows Borders recorded more than  cases in -hour periodldquoThe area in question is extremely rural and the strain on the local road infrastructure from transporting components from Lockerbie to Faw Side would be enormous, he added.ldquoThe proposals for air safety lighting on the turbines would also have an adverse impact on the local landscape.ldquoI will look forward to the findings of the public inquiry and I hope the Scottish Government takes its evidence and the views of the local community very seriously.

title: galashiels-baptist-church-welcomes-new-minister
story: A BORDERS church is ldquodelighted to welcome its new pastor, with more than  people gathering for his Service of Induction.During the service on Saturday, October  at Galashiels Baptist Church, Reverend Euan Johnstone was ordained as a Baptist minister.Galashiels Baptist Church is the first church Rev. Johnstone will be minister of since completing his studies.Church chairperson Valerie Gelder said: ldquoWe are delighted that Euan has accepted the call to Galashiels Baptist Church and are confident his youthful enthusiasm will help guide the church and benefit the local community.Euan completed a degree in Theology at St Andrews University before working with Christian charity Young Le International in Perth.Joined by his we Beth, Rev. Johnstone ndash who is a keen hillwalker ndash will be the churchrsquos first minister since . Rev. Johnstone said: ldquoWe are so grateful for the warm welcome we have received from Galashiels Baptist Church.ldquoI look forward to getting to know the church more in the exciting weeks ahead as we seek to share Godrsquos love with those around us. And I canrsquot wait to get out and about meeting folks in Gala!Services at the Victoria Street church have resumed and take place every Sunday at .am. Services can also be joined by Zoom.Midweek activities such as a lunch club for the elderly, a parents, carers and toddlers group, a crafts club and youth club have also recommenced.You might also be interested in:Public inquiry to settle fate of -turbinewind farm opposed by Borders councilTwo Borders schools recognised for educational excellencersquoCoronavirus: Data shows Borders recorded more than casesin -hour period

title: netflix-announce-full-list-movies-tv-shows-scrapped-november
