title: meet royal british legion poppy collector mirza shahzad
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityPoppy Appeal collector Mirza Shahzad " Meet the man supporting our heroes by selling poppies in PenarthTen generations of Poppy Collectors " Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentTHE  Poppy Appeal across Wales has launched and this year, as the charity marks its centenary, the Royal British Legionis celebrating theof its collectors.This includes Mirza Shahzad, who collects alongside his Muslim youth group in South Wales, including Penarth, and who is part of  generations of poppy collectors brought together by RBL to represent each decade of the charityrsquos historyThe -year-old, representing the s, is regional co-ordinator of the Ahmadiyya Muslim Youth Associationfor the south west of the UK.He has been supporting the Poppy Appeal since moving to the UK from Pakistan in . AMYA members strongly believe in serving humanity, and Mirza is passionate about the RBL because of the extensive support it provides to the armed forces community.Mr Shahzad said: ldquoIrsquom originally from Pakistan but I live in the UK, so I regard the British Military as our heroes.ldquoAMYA takes a lot of pride in supporting the RBL, and by collecting for the Poppy Appeal we help the families of those serving men and women.ldquoI love to see the responses people on the street give when they see an Asian person collecting for the Poppy Appeal."It gives us a great feeling that wersquore doing something very positive by standing with our armed forces.ldquoItrsquos amazing to see people buy p poppies for pound and expect no change, and itrsquoll be great to have the AMYA community back with the rest of the poppy collectors, after we werenrsquot able to collect as we usually would last year.Poppy Appeal collection boxes have come in many shapes and sizes over the years. " alt"Penarth Times: Ten generations of Poppy Collectors" class"editor-image"The poppy-shaped boxfeatures the initials HF for Haig Fund. It was manufactured by Angal, a well-known manufacturer of charity collection boxes, and dates between  and .He is also wearing a limited edition lsquokhadirsquo poppy, issued in  to honour , Indian soldiers who lost their lives fighting for Britain in the First World War. It is made from the same linen worn by Mahatma Gandhi..removeOTHER NEWS:Community Fundraising Manager for the RBL in Wales, Lynne Woodyatt, said: ldquoThis year, as we mark our centenary, we are proud to be celebrating the outstanding contribution of all our Poppy Appeal collectors."Every poppy counts, which is why getting our Poppy Appeal collectors back out in local communities across Wales is so important. As the impact of Covid- continues to leave some members of the Armed Forces community in urgent need of our help, your support is as crucial as ever.ldquoWe cannot help them without you which is why we are urging the people of the north east to look out for their local collector and donate. Your contribution will make a real dference to the lives of those in our Armed Forces community who have given so much.ldquoThe RBL was formed in the aftermath of the First World War to fight for the rights of those who had given so much and come back to so little. Today, we continue to stand with the Armed Forces community, supporting them in the face of hardships, injuries and bereavements. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: family pay tribute barry journalist sharon harris
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communitySharon Harris was found dead in her home on Tuesday, October , aged of .She worked as a journalist in Barry for years, including a -year stint at the Barry and District News. Most recently she worked withthe newly-formedGlamorgan Star.Tributes flooded in as news of her death broke, as she was a journalist that dedicated her le to putting the community of Barry first.Her family said in a statement: "It is so dficult to find the words to sum up my beautul sister and beloved daughter."She was simply our everything and a can-do girl."She overcame so much adversity with her health, but without complaining just got on with living le to the fullest - travelling, volunteering, fundraising and making memories."She was dedicated to being a voice for the Barry community that she loved so much and it was more than a job."Like us, were sure the town will mourn the loss of the kindest, most inspirational woman you could ever wish to meet."We, her family, are devastated."Echoing these words, local politicians who saw Sharon frequently have expressed their condolences.Jane Hutt, MS for the Vale of Glamorgan and minister for social justice said: "Sharon Harris was a champion for the communities she served as local newspaper journalist."She was utterly committed to her job and always seeking the stories which would shine a light on political and public affairs."I admired her tenacity and hard work and was thrilled she was back in force as a leading member of the Glamorgan Star team after  years at Barry and District News."I will always remember taking photos and getting copy at events and requesting lsquoa commentrsquo with deadlines on many dficult but important issues..remove"Dear Sharon you will be greatly missed in the Vale of Glamorgan. RIP.":Cllr Lis Burnett, deputy leader of the Vale of Glamorgan Council, said: ldquoSharon served the Vale of Glamorgan and Barry in particular as a tenacious local reporter for many years."At the Barry and District News and the Glamorgan Star her journalism told the stories of the people that make up our communities."If someone had a story to tell then Sharon gave them a voice."Her death has shocked us all and she will be greatly missed." article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentA SELL-OUT comedy show, which will have you howling with laughter, is relaunching bigger and better than before.Howl comedy nights were founded by Lorna Prichard, starting at Cardfs Tramshed in .In  she left her job reporting for ITV Wales and ldquoswapped headlines for punchlines going into stand-up comedy Howlbecame a monthly event in Penarthrsquos Pier Pavilion in March .ldquoIt was very successful at Pier Pavilion, selling out to  maximum capacity most months, said Ms Prichard.ldquoI always try to curate a really ied, interesting line up of comedians, and my style of MCing is warm, energetic and a little bit chaotic, which seems to go down well."She planned to move the event to a bigger venue, with Penarth Town Council supporting the venture, then the Covid pandemic hit.Although live events were on hold, Ms Prichard kept busy shegot caught up in a whirlwind romance with a Brazilian called Leo ndash they dated long distance before meeting and getting engaged within  hours.ldquoThat descended into typical chaos, laughed Ms Prichard.ldquoI canrsquot wait to share my lockdown experiences with the audience.And share she will ndash with Howl ing for a monthly Saturday night show, with Glee Club level comedians, at Paget Rooms.ldquoIm so excited to be ing to Penarth, said Ms Prichard.ldquoBefore March  it was truly one of the highlights of my month.ldquoThe last  months have been so hard on us all, and we all need a laugh more than ever."Giving it a new home of the Paget Rooms means bigger shows with even bigger comedians, and I really hope Penarth is going to support us so I can keep coming back!Howl Comedy Night will , at the new venue, from .pm on Saturday November .Guests can expect an evening of fun, drinks, and laughter, featuring:STUART GOLDSMITH " alt"Penarth Times: Stuart Goldsmith " class"editor-image"Stuart Goldsmith An internationally award-winning comedian, writer, podcaster, and host. As seen on CBSrsquos Late Night With Conan OrsquoBrien, Russell Howardrsquos Stand Up Centraland As Yet Untitled ..removeHe is also the host of hit comedy podcast, The Comedians Comedian. With a reputation for smart, accessible stand-up, Stuartrsquos enthusiasm and natural charm conceal a quick wit and fearlessness.DON BISWASDon BiswasDon Biswas is one of the gems of the circuit. A politically charged gag merchant who likes to cover a wide range of subjects including his Asian upbringing, his dyspraxia and conspiracy theories.SARAH BRIDGEMANSarah BridgemanFor the last decade Sarah Bridgeman has been a hit with audiences all over the UK with her warm and friendly style. She has been a weird news commentator for BBC Radio Wales, a finalist for the Welsh national comedy competition WUSA , and has written a play based on her experiences in comedy.LORNA PRICHARDLorna PrichardLorna Prichard is a comedian from North East Wales. She is also a trusted broadcaster, having appeared regularly on TV and radio for the last  years. She can frequently be heard on BBC Radio Wales following the success of her weekly show, lsquoSummer Saturdays with Lorna Prichardrsquo.Since then she has been presenting in studio on a regular basis with rugby legends Jonathan Edwards and Nigel Owens, and covering for other presenters like Kiri Pritchard-McLean.Her warm, natural manner and charm endear her to audiences of all ages. She is a gted improviser who can keep her cool no matter what.Following the debut of Howl at Paget Rooms it willfora Christmas show on Saturday, December , with the line-up to be announced soon.Tickets for upcoming shows are available at ticketsource howl article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local community is a creepy and twisted heavy pop song " Love letter to horror: New single launched by Vale rock duoAltered Myths are also headlining a gig at Vulcan Lounge in Cathays, Cardf lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentJUST in time for Hallowersquoen a local band has released their horror-inspired single.Altered Myths ndash a double act featuring Matikwho lives in Penarth, and Eskaywho lives in Barry ndash have launched their new single: .The new song came out on Fridayand will be featured on an EP that they will release in the new year.Matik said: ldquo is our love letter to the horror genre we both grew up with.ldquoWe wanted to create a creepy and twisted heavy pop song and I believe that we have done that.ldquoWe spent the past  months reconnecting with ourselves and our music. We hibernated until the time was right.ldquoWeve been in Safehouse studio, in Oxford, putting together our next two EPs. We believe the world is ready to believe in us. will be the first track featured on the bandrsquos Revamped EPset to release in .The single includes a YouTube video, directed by Matik, which includes lyrics to the track, and graphics by Lee Waters.You can check it out at www.youtu.be ZlKxbMydncThe rockers, who have both been playing their instruments for more than  years, love performing to crowds ndash something thatrsquos been limited over the past  months due to the Covid pandemic.Matik has described their shows as an ldquoexhilarating clash of pantomime and mosh-pit therapy and people can get their fix at Altered Mythsrsquo upcoming headline show.They will be at Vulcan Lounge, in Cardf, on November  with support band Mawpit. title: llantwit major waterspout weather gets spooky
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityJames Thomas, , an agent in the watersports industry, spotted the unusual phenomenon at Llantwit Major Beach in south Wales on Saturday morning.ldquoAs I stood there watching, I thought to myself, this is probably the best example of a waterspout that I will ever get to see in my letime, Mr Thomas told the PA news agency.ldquoOver the years I have seen quite a few of these over the Bristol Channel, but this was by far the biggest.Also known as funnel clouds or tuba, waterspouts form when a rotating column of wind draws in cloud droplets, according to the Met Office.Mr Thomas said he spied Saturdayrsquos weather spectacle while watching a surfing contest.ldquoIt started off fairly small, and quite high in the sky, and as we continued to watch, it appeared to get darker and began angling itself towards the surface of the sea, asit was coming towards us, he said.ldquoI quickly realised it was a waterspout when I could see the rotating spray on the waterrsquos surface, like a magnetic energy.ldquoI was shouting to all the competitors to look up and see this phenomenal natural occurrence.The sighting comes as the Met Office warned parts of the UK may have seen tornadoes on Sunday, as strong winds and rain batter the country.Gusts of over mph have been recorded and yellow warnings for wind and rain are in place over large parts of the west and where. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityJames Thomas, , an agent in the watersports industry, spotted the unusual phenomenon at Llantwit Major Beach in south Wales on Saturday morning.ldquoAs I stood there watching, I thought to myself, this is probably the best example of a waterspout that I will ever get to see in my letime, Mr Thomas told the PA news agency.ldquoOver the years I have seen quite a few of these over the Bristol Channel, but this was by far the biggest.Also known as funnel clouds or tuba, waterspouts form when a rotating column of wind draws in cloud droplets, according to the Met Office.Mr Thomas said he spied Saturdayrsquos weather spectacle while watching a surfing contest.ldquoIt started off fairly small, and quite high in the sky, and as we continued to watch, it appeared to get darker and began angling itself towards the surface of the sea, asit was coming towards us, he said.ldquoI quickly realised it was a waterspout when I could see the rotating spray on the waterrsquos surface, like a magnetic energy.ldquoI was shouting to all the competitors to look up and see this phenomenal natural occurrence.The sighting comes as the Met Office warned parts of the UK may have seen tornadoes on Sunday, as strong winds and rain batter the country.Gusts of over mph have been recorded and yellow warnings for wind and rain are in place over large parts of the west and where. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: st athan railway station considered
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityVale of Glamorgan Council has commissioned a consultancy firm to investigate the possibility of creating a railway station in St Athan.In the past there were two train stations based near the village Gileston and St Athan Road, but these are closed. A third railway station, named St Athan despite being three kilometres to the west of the village near Boverton also no longer operates.But with the Vale of Glamorgan Line reopening in  and new stations located at nearby Llantwit Major and Rhoose Cardf International Airport, the Council wants to explore whether there is an opportunity to re-establish a station near St Athan.Consultants Arcadis will look at an area around a section of the B, Barry to Llantwit Major Road, to determinea suitable site exists.They will consider many factors, including:Those relating to environmental featuresLand informationPlanning constraintsStation requirements, such as vehicle, pedestrian, and cycle accessCllr John Thomas, Vale of Glamorgan Council Ward Member for St Athan, said:ldquoIrsquom delighted that we are looking into the possibility of locating a railway station at St Athan."It has been a long time since one existed in the village and with the local population growing it is sensible that we look into expanding public transport services.Cllr Peter King, Vale of Glamorgan Council Cabinet Member for Neighbourhood services and Transport, added:ldquoI understand the appetite for a railway station in St Athan so we have commissioned consultants to determine whether such a move is feasible.ldquoIncreasing the use of public transport is in keeping with the Councilrsquos Project Zero initiative to reduce carbon emissions so this is something we are very interested in investigating.Once Arcadis have completed the study, their findings will be reported, and the Council will consider whether to take the matter forward. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey title: wales vs south africa autumn nations match   stream watch tv
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe hosts take on World Champions South Africa just seven days after their - defeat to New Zealand.However, unlike in that game, recent history favours Wales when it comes to South Africa.Wales have toppled the Springboks four times in a row at home, with South Africa last departing the Welsh capital victorious eight years ago.Credit: PAldquoWe are always trying to develop our game, said centre Davies, who took over captaincy duties when Alun Wyn Jones went off injured after just  minutes of the New Zealand encounter.ldquoThe one thing this team always shows is that the more time we spend together, the better we get.ldquoWe will dust ourselves off, come in on Monday and look to build and get a result next week at home.ldquoItrsquos the fine details ndash not moving forward on kicks, executing our exits correctly and not putting pressure on ourselves.Credit: PAldquoThe way South Africa play, they want to put pressure on you. For us, itrsquos making sure we build and play in the right areas of the field.ldquoLook, you work extremely hard to get a result, and when you donrsquot get it, it does hurt.ldquoThe beauty of it now is we have another opportunity next week to put the wrongs right. That is what this group will want to show next week.How to watch Wales vs South AfricaThe only way to watch Wales vs South Africa live this year is with Amazon Prime Video.The streaming service secured a new deal to exclusively broadcast Walesrsquo autumn games.All teams, except for Ireland who will be broadcast on Channel , will have their games shown behind the paywall.Amazon Prime costs pound. per month.Credit: PAUsually, Walesrsquo games would also be shown live on SC, however, with Amazon offering a Welsh language service, there will be no live coverage on the free-to-air channel..removeHighlights of all Wales matches will be shown on the evening of the test, with the South Africa highlights starting at .pm on Saturday.Walesrsquo Autumn Nations Series fixturesWales  -  New ZealandWales v South Africa, Principality Stadium, November , .pm kick off, Amazon Prime VideoWales v Fiji, Principality Stadium, November , .pm kick off, Amazon Prime VideoWales v Australia, Principality Stadium, November , .pm kick off, Amazon Prime Video article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: former special adviser pm launches firm speed clinical research
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityMichael Young, together with Meri Beckwith, launched Lindus Health with around pound. million in seed funding from technology and healthcare investors such as Firstminute Capital, Presight Capital, Seedcamp and Hambro Perks.The pair aim to cut the costs of bringing new drugs to market through less expensive clinical trials and better technology, and have created a new clinical trial .They say this will result in faster, safer clinical trials that lead to better health outcomes for the public.Current trials run by Lindus include several from the universities of Oxford, Leeds, Brunel and Nottingham.Mr Young said: ldquoDuring my time in government, I heard time and time again that the way clinical trials are conducted is broken.ldquoThis means that patients are missing out on lesaving treatments.ldquoTo fix this requires a totally new business model for clinical trials. So we founded Lindus Health to do just that and to enable the next generation of healthcare companies.Mr Beckwith said: ldquoTraditional clinical research companies are dinosaurs.ldquoTaking part in a Covid vaccine trial was like stepping into a time machine.ldquoThis was one of the best-funded trials in history but research was done on pen and paper and participants had to go into hospital at the height of the pandemic to fill out forms.ldquoWe founded Lindus Health to make it easier for patients to participate in research, and accelerate the development of new treatments..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Former special adviser to PM launches firm to speed up clinical research article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: aldi donating food charities christmas   get involved
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityFood that does not sell in stores will be donated to local charities rather than go to waste.As part of Aldirsquos pledge to donate  million meals this year to families across the UK facing hunger, the supermarket has committed to donate more meals over the festive period.Christmas is a great time for organisations to benefit from Aldirsquos partnership with Neighbourly, a community engagement  that links businesses to food banks and charities.This enables Aldirsquos UK stores to donate surplus food seven days a week, all year round.Aldi stores will be closed on Christmas Day, Boxing Day and New Years DayWith all Aldi stores set to close on Christmas Day, Boxing Day and NewYearrsquos Day, the retailer wants to ensure that any products approaching the end of their shelf-le reach wont be wasted and can be given to families who might otherwise miss out this Christmas.Charities, food banks and community groups who could benefit from the scheme are encouraged to get in touch and register now for a festive food donation from the supermarket.Existing charity partnerships will be prioritised for these festive collections, but where therersquos availability, additional organisations are being invited to apply to be paired with a local Aldi store to collect fresh and chilled food products ndash including fruit, vegetables, fresh meat, fish and bread ndash ahead of stores closing on both Christmas Eve and New Yearrsquos Eve.Did you know you can get your remembrance poppy in your local Aldi Heres a few of the things were doing to remember our fallen heroes.## #ArmisticeDay #RemembranceSunday pic wsbUgZsKHmdash Aldi Stores UKNovember , Mary Dunn, Managing Director of Corporate Responsibility at Aldi UK, said: ldquoOur food donations scheme operates year-round, but we know that Christmas can be a particularly dficult time for the families and communities we support..removeldquoThatrsquos why we are so committed to increasing the number of meals we donate over the festive season, and we look forward to working with local charities this Christmas to help us meet our  million meals target for the year.Steve Butterworth, from Neighbourly, added: ldquoWith the impact of the pandemic still being felt by communities up and down the country, charities and local causes are eaxpecting record demand for their services this Christmas.ldquoWersquore sure there are lots more groups out there that could put this food to good use, so wersquod encourage them to get in touch.Organisations do not need to be a registered charity to apply but must:Have a level two hygiene certicate gained in the last two yearsBe able to transport and store chilled food products after collecting them on Christmas Eve and New Yearrsquos Eve at pmThose interested in working with Aldi this Christmas should contact Neighbourly at aldichristmas@neighbourly before th December .Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: aldi offering courses help babies sleep
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityAldirsquos baby and toddler brand, Mamia, will start making infant sleeping courses affordable for all UK families.Part of its Specialbuy range, in partnership with Just Chill Baby Sleep, Aldi will help to establish healthy sleep routines for parents and their children.Online courses will start from as little as pound. This is a % discount on standard rates across all sleep courses.Parents can choose from four informative courses that cater for new-borns to four-year-olds:Foundations of Sleep: - months.Practical advice on how to navigate the first few months with a new baby, helping to lay solid sleep foundations and understand their sleep habits: pound. .Sleep Success: - months.Help with nap and bedtime challenge and understanding your babyrsquos sleep needs to help them sleep peacefully and achieve a better sleep quality: pound .Sleep Success: - months.Advice on how to successfully navigate nap times, bedtime and approach nighttime wakingrsquos for a better quality sleep: pound .Sleep Success:  months to  years.Understand a childrsquos sleep needs, including when and how to successfully transition them from a cot to a bed, allowing them to sleep happily in their own space: pound .Rosey Davidson, Infant Sleep Consultant and Founder of Just Chill Baby Sleep, says: ldquoIrsquom so excited that Just Chill Baby Sleep is partnering with Aldirsquos baby and toddler brand, Mamia."For so many parents the cost of in-person sleep support is out of reach, which is why we created our online courses and why this partnership means so much."To be able to offer our courses at a massive % discount and reach even more parents in need is fantastic, and wersquore looking forward to helping new parents and their little ones get the best night sleep possible..remove" alt"Penarth Times: Aldi is offering courses on how to get your baby to sleep for under pound " class"editor-image"Aldi is offering courses on how to get your baby to sleep for under pound Here to offer some advice, Rosey has put together a parental checklist for bedtime which she has shared exclusively with Mamia, to give parents a helping hand at what can be the most dficult time of the day:Have a regular, predictable routineHaving a good balance of sleep in the day can really help your baby to sleep well at night. While all babies are dferent, it can be helpful to think about working towards a routine by doing the same things in the same order each night so that baby learns what is coming next.Think about your little onersquos sleep environmentIt can be helpful to black out bedrooms, something that can be especially important in the summer months. Temperature is also important the Lullaby Trust, the baby sleep charity, say that the safest temperature for our little ones is - degrees celsius.Looking at how your little one falls asleep can help them get a more settled nightIt is very normal for your little one to be fed, rocked or cuddled to sleep, however this can be dficult to maintain. Practice other ways of getting your baby to sleep in their own sleep space to help find a method that suits you, your baby and your parenting style.Watch out for signs of tirednessWhile there are typical s of time that babies will happily stay awake for, the most important thing is getting to know your baby. By observing your baby, you can try to get them down for naps during the day before they get overtired. It is also important not to try to force naps when they are under tired.Fresh air and exerciseGetting out of the house for a bit will blow the cobwebs away and help your little one to burn off some energy. Inside the home your little one will also benefit from lots of time on the floor to keep them moving, while for small babies practising a bit of tummy time can be really helpful.Donrsquot always rush inhellipSometimes your little one will babble or make noise while they are asleep, and by going in too quickly we can disturb them. Equally they can sometimes wake and be happy in their sleep space. If your little one doesnrsquot need your assistance it is important to give them the space to get themselves back to sleep independently.Take care of yourself and donrsquot be afraid to ask for helpTherersquos no shame in not being able to do it all, all of the time. Being sleep deprived can be incredibly challenging and feel very lonely. Please know that is very normal for sleep to be dficult, especially in those early days. Please remember being a parent doesnrsquot always feel easy, because itrsquos not! You are doing a great job.To book a course or find out more, visit the Aldi website.Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: road repairs branded diabolical
story: Nigel Dawson appointed District Master of Portadown LOL No   Upper Bann is in ‘housing crisis’ with current rate of build ‘woefully inadequate’NewsTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthPeopleRead ThisCoronavirusSportFootballOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoHomes and GardensLestyleCarsHomes and GardensPublic NoticesAdvertise My BusinessFree Happy AdsNewsPoliticsRoad repairs branded ‘diabolical’A Portadown councillor has hit out at the condition in which a road was left following recent utility work in the area.By The NewsroomThursday, th November , : am  "       "  The work in question involved the laying of pipes for Firmus Energy on the Armagh Road, Portadown. While acknowledging the work led to delays for motorists, Councillor Lavelle McIlwrath said they were viewed as a necessaryevil in order to deliver services to the area.However, he criticisedthe condition of the repair work between the traffic lights at Mahon junction an Ridgeway Park, describing it as “diabolical”.“I have had numerous complaints from motorists about the way the Armagh Road has been left.“The section of roadway that was dug up cannot now be avoided as you drive towards town and the uneven way the repaired carriageway has been left is shocking.“The irony is that this stretch of roadway was one of the better ones in the area prior to the roadworks and is now one of the worst.”Cllr McIlwrath confirmed he had raisedthe matter with both Firmus Energy and the Department for Infrastructure and said they energy firm has agreed tothe road to its original standard.“I raisedthe matter directly with Firmus Energy as well as the Department for Infrastructure,” he said.“I am pleased to confirm that Firmus Energy has agreed to revisittheir repairs at the Armagh Road and ensure that this stretch of carriageway is ed to its original standard.“The work will take several weeks to plan and coordinate.”Speaking to the Local Democracy Reporting Service, a spokesperson for Firmus Energy confirmed the road surface will be repaired.“We have been liaising with Councillor McIlwrath, the Department for Infrastructure and our contractors to agree a plan to repair the road surface and hope to have that work completed as soon as possible.”Editor’s message:Thank you for reading this article. title: top tips for safe student accommodation
story: With freshers week around the corner and thousands of young people in Northern Ireland set to start University or new career paths, many will be on the hunt for rented accommodation. Northern Ireland has experienced a .% increase in average rental values this year[]. With the price increase, OFTEC, representing the liquid fuel industry in Ireland, is concerned that students may take cheaper accommodation options without properly inspecting the property. With this in mind, OFTEC has issued advise to help students ensure their accommodation is safe before they sign the dotted line. Raise the alarm – Currently, it is not a mandatory requirement for private landlords to provide smoke and carbon monoxide detectors, but the HSENI recommend that they do. It is a legal requirement to fit a carbon monoxide detector when a fossil fuel appliance has been replaced. Carbon monoxide is potentially lethal as it has no smell, taste or colour. Without a working alarm, it is impossible to identy carbon monoxide leaks. OFTEC’s advise is to ensure that there are working fire and CO alarms in the property, and that they are tested on a regular basis.Heating requirements - The Health  Safety Executive recommend that all boilers should be serviced annually and tenants should ask for evidence of recent servicing. If you have concerns, ask for a CD  Landlord Oil Installation Check which is carried out by an OFTEC registered technician and will give you peace of mind. For a gas heated property, ask for a copy of the annual gas safety check.Look for damp – It is easy to hide damp patches with a coat of paint, soyour house smells musty or you see evidence of mould, find out how the landlord is planning to fix the problem. Mould has no place in the home as it can cause respiratory problems and headaches.Furniture and fittings – Ask the landlord for a list of everything that is included and make note of any damage that is there before you move it. Check any beds, sofas and chairs are in good condition.Secure your home – burglars may target student areas because of lax security. Ask your landlord to fit key operating locks on the windows and lever deadlocks on external doors.  OFTEC Ireland Manager, David Blevings, said: “Quite often the excitement of moving in with friends can overshadow the concerns about the accommodation itself. We are urging students to play it safe this year and carry out these essential checks before signing a lease and moving in. “Asking a landlord about safety may seem awkward, but it could prevent you from living in a potentially dangerous property for the next  months. It’s vital that your new home is not a burden as you start your time at university. To find your nearest registered technician visit www.oftec.org  addthis,     Leave your commentTyrone Constitution- High Street, OmaghBT BDTel:     , ,, , ,  .jsp, , ,   , ,success:  ,  n n nHome n n
